attributes.action: Halt Trident renewal and spend the funds on fighting the coronavirus.
attributes.background: Britain should halt its programme of Trident renewal and all work on its nuclear weapon systems, applying the funds, research and technology resources instead to provide vital equipment for the NHS and support the struggle against the coronavirus.
attributes.additional_details: At a time of national and international crisis, Britain can no longer afford to squander vast sums and scientific resources on a policy designed to counter the remote and improbable threat of nuclear attack. The finance and technology involved is now desperately needed to counter a real and actual threat to the lives of millions. Britain should set an example to the other nuclear powers and urge them to take similar initiatives, but it cannot wait for multilateral action which has not been achieved in fifty years. When the crisis is over there can then be a thorough review of strategic priorities.

attributes.action: Prepare & deliver a strategy for developing and using Tidal energy in the UK
attributes.background: To develop a comprehensive strategy to use Tidal energy across the UK. Offer grants to support tidal arrays or tidal farms to help businesses develop a reliable 24/7 renewable energy.
attributes.additional_details:
To reduce carbon emissions energy needs to be produced without using fossil fuels - tidal energy can help do this.
 
The UK has developed a renewable industry based predominantly on bioenergy, solar & wind power. The UK still relies on energy from fossil fuels in addition up to importing energy via interconnectors. The UK has an underused resource around the country. Tide should be used to a greater extent than it is. Grants should be given to help business develop this resource. The UK could develop technologies supporting jobs & allow an export market to be developed for British businesses.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Require new large buildings include renewable energy generation
attributes.background: We want the Government to require new buildings to include renewable power generation, such as solar energy, to ensure that all future commercial and residential building developments accommodating 50 or more people can meet at least 25% of their energy needs for integrated renewable generation.
attributes.additional_details: We want the Government to help us make a cleaner future for all in the UK. Starting by tackling one of the biggest users of fossil fuels; larger residential buildings and workplaces. We want this because in 2020, the UK's fossil fuel dependency was 76.5%. This high consumption of damaging resources puts our future in jeopardy. Introducing a legally bound 25% minimum dependence on integrated renewable energy should reduce reliance on fossil fuels and decrease current over consumption.

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Add a 'sustainability charge' on meat products to cover their environmental cost
attributes.background: Food production accounts for one-quarter of the world’s greenhouse gas emissions and takes up half of the planet’s habitable surface. The mass of animals raised for slaughter on Earth now outweighs wildlife by a factor of 15-to-1. One kilogram of beef needs about 15 thousand litres of water.
attributes.additional_details: By adding a 'sustainability charge' to meat products, this will encourage more conscious meat consumption. With this money going towards tackling climate change and renewable energy resources.

attributes.action: Ban the importation of wood pellets used for the generation of electricity.
attributes.background: Importation of wood pellets should be banned and the use in power stations should be urgently reviewed. Burning of wood pellets must not be considered sustainable or a means of meeting net zero targets. Billions of UK green subsidies into this technology must stop.
attributes.additional_details: Using wood pellets releases more CO2 than burning coal. Because the government considers wood pellets as a renewable resource, by re-planting trees, the emissions are classed as carbon neutral and “helps” to get closer to the neutral target in 2030. This is not the case. Deforestation is happening around the world to supply the UK with wood pellets for burning, which generates around 11% of our energy needs. British taxpayers are funding this destruction of forests.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Renew Government funding of LGBTQ anti-bullying resources for schools
attributes.background: The Government have ceased funding of anti-bullying resources with a specific LGBTQ focus. This should be reviewed and reinstated as a matter of urgency.
attributes.additional_details: LGBTQ youth are more likely to face homelessness, depression, and suicide than their peers, with bullying contributing to this. Education is key to dismantling systems of oppression, especially for youth, so the Government should review their decision to cease funding as a matter of urgency.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/561059

attributes.action: Increase Door Supervisor basic rates of pay to £15ph - Retail SIA to £11ph
attributes.background: Door Supervision has become increasingly needed across the UK and there is still a great lack of Door staff. Security especially since the beginning of the pandemic and after the easing of restrictions and Lockdowns has become more and more needed. It is about time the basic ROP was increased.
attributes.additional_details:
Across the country, standard hours have changed due to earlier opening times for Licensed Premises. More Door Supervisors have been resourced for Retail security etc. The shortage of staff increases but the vacancies are unappealing because of the poor rates of pay. NMW for some Retail work. It is unfair and degrading considering SIA staff have to pay for courses/license and renewals now only subject to completing and paying for up-skilling and first aid training.
Now being worse off financially.

rejection.details: This is a matter for individual employers, not the Government.
